conclusion: Need to analyze both figures to determine wave direction and speed
Figure 1 shows waveform at t=2s with amplitude A=10cm, x-axis in meters
Wave is sinusoidal and moving along x-axis
Wavelength is 4 meters from x=1m to x=5m
Figure 2 shows particle vibration at x=2m over time
Y-axis is displacement, x-axis is time in seconds
Graph shows sinusoidal pattern indicating harmonic motion
Time period T is 4 seconds from t=0s to t=4s
At t=2s, particle at x=2m is at maximum positive displacement
At t=0s in Figure 2, particle at x=2m is at zero displacement moving upwards
Wave is moving in positive x-direction
Wave speed v calculated using v = λ/T
Wavelength λ=4m and Time period T=4s
Direction of Wave Propagation: Positive x-direction, Wave Speed: 1 m/s
